name: places/ChIJXfUq9nP2wokRfvJ0MbViUnM
formattedAddress: 455 Malcolm X Blvd, New York, NY 10027, USA
adrFormatAddress: 455 Malcolm X Blvd, New York, NY 10027, USA

originalText.text:
Have been going here for years and the service has declined miserably. I consistently have appointments that get canceled by doctors.

They also try to make me pay consistent copays when I want a trial of contacts and they want me to purchase before me even trying the contacts out.

Nobody purchases anything before knowing how the product is.

Last day going here. I advise anyone not to go. Thank me later :)

originalText.text: I have been coming to Harlem Vision for 6 six years and I have to take my business elsewhere at this point. I had the most unpleasant experience with a female Doctor here by the name of Arielle Roberts she was combative and unprofessional about an insurance issue that I had informed her I would follow back on at a later date when I got in touch with my provider. My visit to the eye doctor should have been an “easy breezy” experience but she made it an uncomfortable and quite frankly stressful visit. I will no longer be using this eye care provider because of this incident. This review is in no way a reflection of the front of house staff the Office Manger was very polite and informative without attitude and the other Receptionist was polite as well.

originalText.text: I do not recommend this facility. I had been going there for my annual eye exams for the past 3 years. A year ago a fist fight broke out in the waiting area while I was there, and last month I arrived at my appointment on time and then waited 1½ hours to be seen. I walked out before I actually saw the doctor.

text.text: I do not recommend this facility. I had been going there for my annual eye exams for the past 3 years. A year ago a fist fight broke out in the waiting area while I was there, and last month I arrived at my appointment on time and then waited 1½ hours to be seen. I walked out before I actually saw the doctor.

originalText.text: Just got off the phone with a highly rude receptionist. My daughter came in August 29, 2023. So it’s almost 2 months that my daughter is walking around with blurry vision & her teachers are now complaining because my daughter is unable to efficiently do her schoolwork. The receptionist said the doctor has been out of network for 3 weeks which makes zero send because we came in august & today is now October 27th so my daughter should have received her glasses prior. I’m highly disappointed, I will soon be switching.

originalText.text: This place has gotten worst over the pass 2 years. This is my second appointment where I wanted 2 hours plus to complete a visit. First for my kids now myself. This will be my last visit. At this point they can burn out records. Avoid at all cost.
